intro: Acinodendron tetrastomum, commonly known as the four-stoma acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Acinodendron tetrastomum is often found in humid, shaded environments within forests.
